New Records: Amed Rosario hit his first home run since April 17th
Key Match Events: The Brewers got off to a 3-0 lead with a three-run home run by Willy Adames
The Reds battled back with two runs in the fifth inning on Spencer Steer's two RBI single
The game was tied at four after Amed Rosario's two-run home run
Noelvi Marte's apparent home run was brought back by Blake Perkins
The game went into a dramatic ninth inning
Justin Wilson allowed an opposite-field go-ahead home run to Jackson Chourio
Jake Bauers made a game-saving diving play to end the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Reds have lost 37 of their last 50 games to the Brewers
The Reds are 11-26 in one-run games
The Reds are 19-23 against the NL Central
The Reds are 12-49 when allowing five runs or more
